tip.text: The area over by tracks 36 to 42 is never crowded even during rush hour. The Biltmore Room has a flower stand, large shoe shine station & news stand. Lines for the ticket machines tend to be shorter.
The one place I thought I'd be able to earn my Swarm badge, I guess going upstate on a Saturday morning was not the right time. One day....
This is a great location to stay when coming to NYC for the US Open.
New timetables starting Monday 6.21.10 pay attention to changes
CT for the weekend and birthday dinner with a good friend
Beware of double strollers, the 42nd street entrance is the only door that will fit you
dont buy anything in here! to damn expensive hit up Lexington if you need stuff! duane read is right out front on 42nd n LEX
Cheese cake !!!
Not as hard to navigate around as I would have expected. Shopping and food everywhere. Two Boots is awesome. I forgot to check in when I was there lol
Stop by Annie moores if you are waiting for a train
Welcome to Grand Central! Don't forget to check in on Foursquare from the train as well. Trains, buses, planes, & boats are all valid Foursquare venues that you can become the mayor of!
Only open til 9:30pm otherwise you'll have to go thru the main terminal.
This is where it all begins. Or ends. Where S returned from boarding school, where B headed to Yale, and where D and S struck up an unlikely romance. (I Will Always Love You)
Agua Fresca smoothies at Dishes are the perfect treat for your ride home after a long day at the office. Mmmm!
Watch out for the creepy hair/spa promotion guys!
Loop up at the northwest corner of the ceiling in the grand concourse and find the strip of grime the cleaners left to remind us how dirty gct once was.
Magnolias bakery is comming soon!
Get HISTORIAN - 4SQ badge!
Wisper into the corners....
Stop by Murray's for the best cheese in NYC. Say hi to my friend Will
GCT really needs a Dunkin Donuts to go with all these Starbucks!
Learn the difference between Grand Central Terminal and Grand Central Station. Impress your friends!
In your commuting rush take a moment to notice the gorgeous sliding pocket doors that separate the tracks from the main hall.
Look at the ceiling in the Main Concourse. A single dark patch remains above the Michael Jordan Steakhouse, left untouched by renovators to remind visitors of the grime that once covered the ceiling.
You have to check out the secret speakeasy called the Campbell Apartment--very cool hidden jem.
The 67 tracks are numbered according to their geographic location in the terminal building rather than the trains' destinations, because all of the trains terminate at Grand Central.
To the tip from lucky magazine, hire a fact checker... The manhattan mall???
Look for the girls dressed in camo on 3/24 giving away makeup at 4pm thru 6pm!!!
I use http://www.mnrmobile.com/ to get live train AND track info for Grand Central on my iPhone
Most of the food is overpriced and okay. Not great. Zaros is fast for morning commute goodies.
The place isn't as grand as I thought...not so central either...
I use http://www.mnrmobile.com/ to get live train AND track info for Grand Central
If your coming from uptown get in the 2nd car from the back of train, 1st door...leaves your right @ stairs, otherwise good luck in the clusterf#*k
How many movies were shot here?
Enter on 47th and Madison, trains usually leave from the first set of tracks on right hand side.
Pershing Square is right around the corner. Yumtown!
Go to the grand hall and look up!
I use "station stops" on my iPhone to get the train schedule
when you in GCT waiting for you train home chat up the crazies lower level food concourse
Lacey Jo says, "Behold the Power of MEOW."
$3.50 for a Vitaminwater at Hudson News . Ouch!
Google the amazing whispering wall
Can't leave here without a black & white cookie from Zaros. "It's the perfect cookie. And yet, racial harmony eludes us..."
Starbucks coffee usually has poor service here. Get equally good coffee for 1/3 the price at Hot & Crusty
Know what's going on under GCT? Ask me, that's where I work.....
Have time to kill? The closest thing to a mall in NYC, the shops at Grand Central Station run the gamut from high-end lingerie to French pastries.
Check out the Madrid Art Walk in Vanderbilt Hall, courtesy of the Spain Department of Tourism.
Don't expect much food at the food court on a Sunday evening. Most places are closed by 9pm.
Best oysters in the city are at Oyster Bar
I use Clever Commute for track announcements and delay updates.
If you need a quick bite to eat, head downstairs to Two Boots for a slice and a Coke.
Check out the musicians in the GrayBar passage.
Sangria from Zocalos.....
Download a free book at http://bookboon.com using the wireless at Starbucks - helps kill the time and saves money!
Magnolia bakery coming soon to grand central = red velvet cupcakes on the ride home.
I use railbandit on my blackberry to plan trips, get schedules and service updates
3rd car from back of train will open doors perfectly opposite staircase at OG
Go to the GC Market. You will be amazed at the selection.
Meet people on the West Balcony, it is way easier than trying to pick out people on the ground level.
Go for a Joe coffee.
In inclement weather, use the passageway on the west side of the station to walk undergroud and emerge at 45th & Madison...or use the Northeast or Northwest Passages to get all the way to 47th St
Always arrive early. Always be prepared. Don't stand and stare at the constellations like a tourist.
Always arrange to meet friends at The Clock.
Best place to just people watch.
There's nothing like streaking across the main floor area during rush hour. Tourists love it!
off-peak
Reminder: Tues., December 8th is "Don't Wear Pants at Grand Central" Day.
Reminder that Tuesday, December 8th, is "Don't wear pants at Grand Central" Day.
a secret, in the form of a new york minute: metro-north trains leave roughly one minute after the posted departure time. do you dare test this theory?
If you see a person walking aimlessly while staring at their blackberry, feel free to smack them across the head.
Stop at Joe's the Art of Coffee. Good strong cup at a good price.
See you if you can find the one piece of ceiling they left uncleaned as a reminder
The excellent place to take the photo and good place to take a rest. There is a good cheese cake-Juniors you can enjoy!
I would advise not to ask someone to remove his/her feet from the seats. just saw it happen and let me just say... it didn't turn out so well for the asker.
get a shoeshine at eddies with mauro
I added Soapnana as my friend on foursquare
la Cucina is a great early morning breakfast spot
Go to Grand Central and run across the main concourse screaming about how you are late for your boat.
visit the whispering gallery with a friend.
Go to Grand Central. Get cheap buzz from beer carts in the food court, and snack on guacamole & nachos from Zocalo.
Go to Transit Museum's Gallery Annex at Grand Central Terminal to learn what's digging under NYC (until 7/5/09). Get Ciao Bella from the food court after.
Grand Central is one of the oldest US train stations still standing. Unequivocal beauty and amazing architecture. Even if you're not going anywhere go inside and just look around!
GCTs Whispering Gallery (in front of the Oyster Bar). Take someone cute so she can hear your sweet nothings
